DOC.brief_summary: To compare 5-year overall survival patient undergo radical hysterectomy follow tailored adjuvant therapy patient receive primary chemoradiation therapy FIGO stage IB2 IIA2 cervical cancer
DOC.brief_title: Radical Hysterectomy Followed Tailored Adjuvant Therapy Versus Primary Chemoradiation Therapy Bulky Early-stage Cervical Cancer ( KGOG 1029 )
DOC.criteria: Previously untreated , histologically confirm cervical cancer FIGO stage IB2 IIA2 disease One follow histologic type 1 . Squamous cell carcinoma 2 . Adenocarcinoma 3 . Adenosquamous carcinoma Gynecologic Oncology Group performance status : 02 Adequate organ function 1 . Bone marrow : WBC > 3000/mm3 , ANC ≥ 1,000/mm3 , Platelet ≥ 100*103/mm3 , Hemoglobin ≥ 10g/dL 2 . Kidney : Creatine < 1.25 * upper normal limit 3 . Liver : AST , ANT < 3 * upper normal limit , Total bilirubin < 1.5 mg/mm3 Patient Singed approve informed consent Patients cervical cancer receive previous radiation chemotherapy Neuroendocrine carcinoma uterine cervix Occult cervical cancer find simple hysterectomy Paraaortic nodal involvement ( > 10 mm short axis diameter pretreatment image study ) History invasive malignancy , exception nonmelanoma skin cancer , situ melanoma thyroid cancer , ( ) evidence cancer present within last 5 year Serious illness medical condition precludes safe administration trial treatment include , limited , ongoing active infection , symptomatic congestive heart failure , unstable angina pectoris , cardiac arrhythmia , psychiatric illness/social situation would limit compliance study requirement Prior diagnosis Crohn 's disease ulcerative colitis Neurologic psychiatric disease Patients pregnant lactating
